feed.subtitle: A series of daily landscape photographs by Daniel Sofer, 20 years running.

entry.title: Green Season・緑の季節
entry.content:
The rain this time of year makes everything a lush shade of green.

この季節、雨で全てが青々とした緑色に染まる。
entry.summary: The rain this time of year makes everything a lush shade of green.

entry.title: Kameyama-ya・亀山屋
entry.content:
On my morning walk along the Oigawa river before this soba and oden restaurant opened. It had just stopped raining, so the sky was dark and the air was thick with moisture.

この蕎麦とおでんの老舗がまだ開店前の、大堰川沿いの朝の散歩道。雨上がりで空は暗く、しっとりとした空気に包まれていた。
entry.summary: On my morning walk along the Oigawa river before this soba and oden restaurant opened. It had just stopped raining, so the sky was dark and the air was thick with moisture.

entry.content:
Women on the path along the Oi River.

大堰川沿いの道を行く女性たち。
entry.summary: Women on the path along the Oi River.

entry.title: Art Reflection・芸術的反映
entry.content:
The Kyoto City Kyocera Museum is reflected in the glass windows of The Triangle building at left.

左側の「ザ・トライアングル」建物のガラス窓に、京都市京セラ美術館が映っている。
entry.summary: The Kyoto City Kyocera Museum is reflected in the glass windows of The Triangle building at left.

entry.title: Arriving Train・着く電車
entry.content:
A long exposure transforms the arriving train at Hankyu’s Kami Katsura Station into a blur of light and shadow.

長時間の露出により、阪急「上桂駅」に到着する電車が、光と影のぼやけた姿に変貌した。
entry.summary: A long exposure transforms the arriving train at Hankyu’s Kami Katsura Station into a blur of light and shadow.

entry.title: Port of Osaka・大阪港
entry.content:
This photo of the Tempozan Bridge and Ferris Wheel at the Port of Osaka is a composite of two photos taken an hour apart: one before, one after sunset. At the top-left of the photo is the Yodo River; center-right is the Aji River, which changes names several times as it passes through the city. This photograph looks Northeast, about 90°clockwise from the photo of Osaka Expo in the previous post.

この大阪港の天保山橋と観覧車の写真は、1時間間隔で撮影した2枚の写真を合成したものです。1枚は日没前、もう1枚は日没後です。写真の左上には淀川、右中央には市内を流れる途中で何度か名前が変わる安治川が見えます。この写真は、前回の投稿の大阪万博から時計回りに約90°、北東方向を向いています。
entry.summary: This photo of the Tempozan Bridge and Ferris Wheel at the Port of Osaka is a composite of two photos taken an hour apart: one before, one after sunset. At the top-left of the photo is the Yodo River; center-right is the Aji River, which changes names several times as it passes through the city. This photograph looks Northeast, about 90°clockwise from the photo of Osaka Expo in the previous post.

entry.title: The Ring・グランドリング

link.title: The Ring・グランドリング

entry.content:
An aerial view captured from Cosmos Tower, showcasing the Grand Ring of Osaka Kansai Expo 2025 in the foreground, with the Kobe skyline stretching across the distant horizon.

コスモスタワーから撮影した空撮写真。手前には大阪・関西万博2025のグランドリングが映し出され、遠景には神戸のスカイラインが広がる。
entry.summary: An aerial view captured from Cosmos Tower, showcasing the Grand Ring of Osaka Kansai Expo 2025 in the foreground, with the Kobe skyline stretching across the distant horizon.

entry.title: Boats at Sunrise
entry.content:
Sunrise in Arashiyama, illuminating the flat bottom boats (yakatabune) tied up at the dock.

嵐山で、桟橋に停泊する屋形船を照らす朝日。
entry.summary: Sunrise in Arashiyama, illuminating the flat bottom boats (yakatabune) tied up at the dock.

entry.title: Nakanoshima Evening・中之島宵景
entry.content:
A long exposure captures the flowing water of the Katsura River along Nakanoshima Island at twilight. A heron stands motionless, looking for this evening’s dinner.

長時間露出で夕暮れの中之島沿いを流れる桂川の水の流れを捉えた。サギが今夜の餌を探して、じっと立ち尽くしている。
entry.summary: A long exposure captures the flowing water of the Katsura River along Nakanoshima Island at twilight. A heron stands motionless, looking for this evening’s dinner.
